div.sent: Allah has created us.
He is our Cherisher.
He is our Lord.
We are His servants.
Our life and death are at His disposal.
He has arranged this.
world for us in what a nice way!
We enjoy all these.
He has created us as best of the creation.
We must be grateful to Him for enjoying His unlimited bounties.
To lead life according to His rules and expressing gratitude for the bounties, is called Ibadat.
We shall aide by His Commandments and worship Him only.
Ibadat is an Arabic term.
It means obedience, obedience to Allah.
And in Islami terminology to follow all the commandments and prohibitions of Allah is Ibadat.
Allah has created everything for the betterment of men.
He has created the Jinn and the human beings for His adoration.
Re says in the Quran.
I have created- Jinns and the human beings only for the reason that they may.
We shall do good deeds and advise others for doing good deeds.
They will get reward following our advice.
We shall also.
get the same reward.
We must perform some unavoidable specified Ibadat like Salat, Sawm, Hajj and zakat.
We shall perform these deeds in the same way as the Prophet (Sm) did and asked us to do so.
These Ibadats may be divided into three kinds.
Ibadat jismi or physical Ibadat.
Ibadat Mali or financial Ibadat.
Ibadat mixed with both physical and financial.
The Iadat which is done with the help of the organs of the body is called physical Ibadat.
For example : Performance of five times Salat and fasting in the month of Ramjan (Ramadan).
Of all the Ibadats, physical Ibadat is more important.
The Ibadats which are done with money or wealth are called Ibadat-e-Mali or financial Ibadat.
For example: Paying zakat, donation and other charities etc. Ibadat mixed with both physical and financial:
Rather both are necessary.
For example: Hajj, Jihad etc.
Since Allah has created us for Ibadat, hence it is our duty to devote ourselves all the times in Ibadat.
Now the question may arise whether it is possible to involve all times in Ibadat.
Yes, it is possible to involve twenty four hours in Ibadat.
And this is Ibadat.
If we start for school with Bismillah, then Allah will protect us from all kinds of mishaps on the way.
In this way we can devote ourselves all the time in Ibadat.
Allah remains pleased for Ibadat.
Thus, we can get happiness and pleasure in the worldly life.
And the life hereafter will be very peaceful and there we can achieve the heaven.
And those who do not do Ibadat and do not follow the path of Allah, Allah remains displeased upon them.
They do not get peace in this world.
They will also get severe punishment of the hell in the after world.
Shall be able to explain the meaning.
and significance of Ibadat.
Shall be able to narrate the kinds of Ibadat and shall be careful to do Ibadat.
Cleanliness is necessary for Ibadat.
No Salat can be performed without cleanliness.
To touch the holy Quran is not allowed in an unclear condition.
So it is necessary for us to remain always neat and clean.
Taharat means cleanliness, like: Ablution, bathing etc.
No Ibadat is accepted without cleanliness (holiness).
Cleanliness makes the body healthy, the mind remains cheerful, and it helps to absorb in mindful study and other works.
Everybody loves those who remain clean and wear clean dress.
Which means: Cleanliness and purity are parts of Iman.
Najasat means pollution, unclean and impurity.
This is opposite to Taharat or cleanliness.
Najasat-e-Hagiqi are those matters which are usually hated by people.
Every body preserves his body, usable dresses and other materials from those things.
But according to Islamic rules those are included in Najasat, like: Breaking ablution, having necessity for bathing etc.
There are many ways to attain purity, and ablution is the best of those ways.
No Salat is accepted without ablution.
None can touch the holy Quran without ablution.
We shall have ablution before Salat.
Rub your heads (with water) and (wash) your feet to the ankles.
The Prophet (Sin) said: I shall be able to recognize my Ummat, or the followers on the Day of Resurrection.
The Prophet (Sm) said: Because of wadu the faces, hands and elbows of my followers will be shining.
Hence, I shall be able to recognize my followers.
So we should perform wadu in a nice way to get that reward and blessings.
With the intention of having holiness and purity first of all two hands upto the wrist are to be washed.
And if not fasting, inside of the mouth is to be washed with gargling.
Then to clean the nose three times with water.
And then to wash the whole face in such a way that a single hair may not remain dry.
In the case of thick beard the water should reach upto the origin.
then two hands are to be washed upto the elbows.
And the head and ears are to be touched with the wet hands.
At last, neck is to be touched with the backside of the fingers of two hands.
After the touching (Masah) part is over two legs are to be washed up to the ankles properly.
These formalities of wadu should be done one after another quickly and having no delay.
This kind of purification is called Tayammum.
With the intention-of attaining purification of the face it is to be touched with the two hands having clean soil.
Again, having two hands on the soil they should touch the hands upto the elbows.
Niyyat or intention (of attaining purification) is obligatory or Farz in Tayammum.
The literal meaning of Gosal is washing.
In Islamic terminology Gosal is to wash the whole body according to rule and with the intention of removing pollution.
At first, taking water in the right hand the two hands are to be washed upto the wrist.
If any polluted things are in the body that should be washed, then two hands should be washed nicely.
While gargling, the water should reach inside.
the throat and then in nose.
After, the wadu is over, water should be removed from the hand.
No place of the body may remain dry.
The body should be cleaned.
For the women, needless to open the coiffure or verbena.
Of course, water should reach upto the root of the hair.
Shall be able to explain Taharat and Najasat.
Shall be able to narrate the necessity of Taharat.
Shall be able to tell the rules of Wadu, Gosal and Tayammum.
Shall be habituated to remain holy and purified through regular wadu and gosal (ablution.
Among the five pillars of Islam, Kalima, Salat, Sawm, Hajj and Zakat, Salat is the most important one.
The literal meaning of Salat is to face towards any one.
Proceed on, to pray and to attain nearness.
Men can attain maximum nearness of Allah through Salat.
About its importance, Allah says.
Which means: Certainly prayer (Salat) restrains from shameful and unjust deeds.
The Prophet (Sm) said: One who performs five times Salat with congregation, Allah will give him five rewards:
Allah will remove the dearth of his livelihood.
He will set him free from the punishment in the grave.
The ledger of his life will be given at the right hand.
He will cause him to cross the Pulsirat Bridge in an electric speed.
He will award him the heaven without taking any account.
Which means: Salat is (like) a pillar of Islam.
One who establishes Salat constructs the pillar of Islam like that of a building.
And he who has given up Salat, has broken Islam (like a building).
In the same way, he who establishes Salat, will easily enter into the paradise:
Allah has commanded to perform Salat in time.
Salat is not established if it is not performed in time.
In this matter, Allah says: Surely, performing Salats (prayers) at the specified times is compulsory for the believers.
We must know the correct time of performing Salat.
Fajar : The time of Fajar Salat begins from Subhi Sadiq and ends with the rising of the sun.
This bright light increases gradually and then the sun rises.
The shadow of every thing just at noon is called (Saya Asli) the original shadow.
For example, the shadow of a stick of three yards length, just at noon is one yard.
Therefore, when the shadow of the stick will be seven yards, the time of Zuhar Salat (prayer) will be over.
But to perform Asar Salat is Makruh (defective) when the sun takes yellow colour.
The time of Maghrib Salat is very short.
Hence, the performance of this Salat should be started as soon as the time begins.
Isha : The time of Isha Salat begins after the end of Maghrib Salat and it lasts upto Subhi Sadiq.
Of course, it is better to perform it within the first half of the night.
to perform the Salat after midnight is Makruh (defective).
Vitr : The time of vitr and Isha Salat is the same.
Vitr Salat is to be performed after Isha Salat.
Vitr Salat cannot be performed before Isha Salat.
A brief Chart of the time table of Salat is given below.
Just at the time of the sunrise.
Just at noon.
When the sun takes red colour till it sets.
Only the Asar Salat of that day could be performed, if not performed for any genuine reason.
To perform all kinds of Farz, Wajib, Sunnat and Nafol Salats is pohibited in the above mentioned times.
After the Fajar Salat till the sun does not rise.
After Asar upto the sunset.
Any kind of Salat at the time of Fajar except the Sunnat of the time.
To start any Salat when the Takbir of Farz Salat is given.
To perform Salat before the Farz Salat of Maghrib at the time of Maghrib Salat.
To perform Salat when the Imam delivers his jumua sermon (Khutba).
To perform Isha Salat after the mid-night.
The best (Mustahab) time of Salat: The best time of performing Salat is given below:
Performing Fajar Salat after the brightening of Subhi Sadiq.
Performing Zuhar Salat at a little delay during the summer season.
Performing Maghrib Salat without any delay.
Preforming Isha Salat during the first one third of the night.
Every work has some rules.
One can get good result if he does the work according to the rules.
The Prophet (Sm) taught us Salat practically for its being an important ibadat.
When one wishes to perform Salat, he must be certain that no Shart or pre- condition of Salat is dropped.
He is looking at me.
Women are to bind hands over the chest.
Niyyat or intention in mind is enough.
But oral pronunciation is better.
Then we shall recite `Sana.
Then we shall recite Fatiha Sura after saying Auzubillahi minash shaitanir rajim, bismillahir Rahmanir Rahim.
We shall say-Amin in mind reciting Fatiha.
Shall recite Subhana Rabbial Azim in the Ruku at least three times.
And then stand straight saying Samiallahu liman hamida.
And shall say Rabbana lakal hamd in that standing position, then shall go to Sijda saying ALLAHU AKBAR.
Shall say at least three times Subhana Rabbial A'ala in the Sijda.
and then we shall stand up straight saying ALLAHU AKBAR.
In this way we shall complete the first Rakat.
Now the second Rakat begins.
We shall recite Sura Fatiha saying Bismillahir Rahmanir Rahim.
Being sitted, shall recite .
Thus the Salat having two Rakats will be completed.
Only Tashahhud is to be uttered after the second Rakat in the Farz Salat of three Rakats.
Then stand Straight saying Takbir, then saying Bismillahir, Rahmanir Rahim shall recite only Sura Fatiha adding no other Sura.
And then perform Ruku and Sijda.
And then recite only Fatiha after saying Bismillahir Rahmanir Rahim adding no other Sura.
Then after Ruku and Sijda shall stand for the fourth Rakat.
We shall be able to say the rules of performing Salat and we shall perform Salat correctly.
Salat can be performed at home or at any other places.
But mosque is the best place to perform Salat.
Twenty seven times rewards could be found if Salat is performed in congregation at the mosque.
Mosque is the house of Allah.
And bow down your heads with those who bow down (in worship).
It means, perform Salat with congregation.
Even stress has been given to perform Salat in congregation in the battle field facing the enemies.
We shall be able to narrate the importane of performing Salat in congregation and shall perform Salat regularly in congregation.
There are some very important conditions for Salat without a single condition Salat will be void.
These are called essentials (Farz) of Salat.
The number of Farz in Salat is fourteen.
Of these, seven are preparatory before the beginning of Salat which are called Ahkam or Shart.
Cleanness and purity of the place of Salat.
To perform Salat facing the Qibla (Ka'ba).
To perform Salat during the time of the Salat.
Niyyat or intention of Salat.
There are seven other Farz inside the Salat which are called Arkan.
Takbir Tahrima or saying ALLAHU AKBAR, having Niyyat of Salat.
To perform Salat standing, if unable, sitting, if unable, lying with hints.
Last sitting where Tashahhud, Darud, Dua Masura are to be uttered and complete the Salat with Salam.
To come out of Salat with the help of some deed (Such as, Salam).
Wajib (bounded duties) in Salat are fourteen.
To read Sura Fatiha in every Rakat.
To add any Sura or part of Sura with Sura Fatiha.
To maintain chronology of Ruku, Sijda and the verses of the Quran read in the Salat.
To sit straight between two Sijdas.
To perform Rukons of the Salat correctly.
To stand straight after Ruku.
To recite Tashahhud.
To recite Dua Qunut in the vitr Salat.
To do Telawat Sijda if any verse of Sijda is recited in the Salat.
To keep both the hands and knees on earth during Sijda.
To say additional six Takirs during the two Id Salats.
To complete the Salat saying Assalamu Alaikum wa Rahmatullah.
The Prophet (Sm) apart from Farz and Wajib used to perform some other things.
These are called Sunnat.
The prophet (Sm) did not give so much stress for these activities as he did for Farz and Wajib.
Hence, there is no need for Sahu Sijda if any of these activities is dropped.
Yet these should be performed, because the Prophet (Sm) himself did these and asked others to do so.
To make open the fingers of the two hands, facing the Qibla at the time of saying Takbir.
Not to bow down head at the time of saying Takbir Tahrima.
To say Takbir loudly for the Imam (on the part of the Imam).
To recite Sana.
To recite Aujubillah.
To add Bismillah before Fatiha in every Rakat.
To recite Sura Fatiha only in the third and fourth Rakat of Farz Salat.
To say Amin After Fatiha.
To utter Sana, `Aujubillah and Amin silently.
To follow Sunnat Tariqa in the Qirat.
To recite Tasbih at least three times both in Ruku and Sijda.
To spread out the left leg and to sit on it at the time of sitting.
To hint with the Shahadat finger while saying La ilaha in Tashahhud.
To recite Darud in the last sitting.
To recite Dua Masura or any other Dua like this after Darud.
To say Salam to the right side first and then to the left.
These are called Mustahab.
Some Mustahabs of the Salat are given below.
To look at the place of Sijda while standing in Salat.
To try to check from sneezing, gasping and coughing as far as possible.
To recite the Quran calmly.
To put the head between the two hands in Sijda.
To recite short Sura in Maghrib Salat.
To read Tasbih more than three times in Ruku and Sijda while performing Salat alone.
At the beginning of Salat we bind hands saying Allahu Akbar, with Niyyat.
This is called Takbir Tahrima.
With this Takbir all deeds and wordings other than those of Salat become Haram (strictly prohibited).
If any one does any prohibited thing then the Salat will be `invalid.
We should know those things which break the Salat.
The causes of breaking Salat are given below: l.
To offer greetings to anyone or to respond to the same from others during Salat.
To talk in the Salat.
To eat something in the Salat.
To drink anything.
To laugh loudly.
To cry loudly for any worldly hardship.
To say Uh, or Ah, because of pain or any other disease.
To recite the Quran looking into it.
To turn the face away from the direction of the Qibla.
To work with two hands.
To stand comparatively ahead of the Imam.
To offer Sijda in any impure place.
To pray for any worldly (harmful) thing.
To cough again and again willingly for nothing.
If any Farz of the Salat is dropped.
To say `Alhamdulillah'hearing any good news in the Salat.
To say `Inna lillah on any bad news.
To say `Alhamdulillah after sneezing.
To say `Yarhamukumullah responding to sneezing.
To detect a mistake of anyone other than his Imam.
There are some activities which make Salat defective and cause for less reward though the Salat is not nullified.
These activities are called `Makruh.
We should keep ourselves away from these activities.
To snap the finger in the Salat, without any reason.
To perform Salat without putting a cap on the head out of idleness.
To roll the cloth for saving it from the dust.
To move the cloth, button, beard etc. uselessly.
To wear such dress that no people like to put on for going to the bazar and in any congregation.
To begin Salat having necessity of discharging stool or urine.
To look at this way or that.
To spread out two hands up to the elbows in Sijda.
To stand within the `Mehrab that is reserved for the Imam.
To wear any dress having picture of animals on it.
To stand alone in the back row, while there is room (vacancy) in the front row.
To extend Salam with hints.
To do Sijda.
only with forehead or only with the nose.
To stand as the Imam on a high place without any reason.
To sit with fore knees without any reason.
To perform Salat with closed eyes except for more concentration.
To bow down for Ruku before the Qirat is completed.
To drop any Sunnat in the Salat.
To raise the legs from earth during Sijda.
To count the verses or Tasbih with the finger in Salat.
To have anything in the mouth which distrubs the Qurat (recitation from the Quran).
We shall be able to narrate the causes of breaking and defecting Salat, and shall be cautious of those activities.
Sahu means mistake.
If any mistake is done in the Salat there to offer two Sijdas at the last sitting is obligatory.
These are called Sijda Sahu or Sijda for the rectification of mistake.
If any Wajib is dropped out of mistake.
Delay in performing any Farz or to break the continuity like: performing Sijda before the Ruku.
To perform any Farz more than once in the place of only once.
There are some verses in the holy Quran that, one who recites or hears, must perform Sijda.
No matter whether the full verse or a part of the verse is recited.
Sijda must be performed on reciting or hearing the very word Sijda in the verse concerned.
It will be a sin if Sijda is not performed.
I (devil) have also got the order of Sijda but I denied and became the heller.
Sijda Telawat is to be done facing the Qibla after standing with the Niyyat of Sijda Telawat saying ALLAHU AKBAR.
After Sijda be raised to standing position saying ALLAHU AKBAR.
Only one Sijda is enough.
There is no need for Tashahhud and Salam.
There are four Shafts or conditions for Sijda Telawat.
We shall be able to narrate the rules of Sijda-i-Tilawat and shall perform the Sijda Tilawat.
